alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Madison (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 04 at 6:58PM CDT until November 05 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll and Madison. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 657 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Radar estimates of up to 1 inch of rain has fallen already. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches and locally higher are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Berryville... Huntsville... Eureka Springs... Green Forest... St. Paul... Beaver... Hindsville... Marble... Forum... Withrow Springs State Park... Clifty... Aurora... Kingston... Rudd... Witter... Rule... Osage... Japton... Hobbs State Park... Grandview... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
